Please report issues and new feature requests to sami.viitanen@gmail.com

Thanks!

Credits

Programming and Graphics
Sami Viitanen

Testing and Special Thanks
---
If you can choose, please use NTAG203 NFC tags for the best compatibility with all devices. Writable memory of NTAG203 tag is also large enough to contain needed Bluetooth pairing data.
Copyright Sami Viitanen 2011–2014, All rights reserved.

This application allows you to write Bluetooth connectivity information to NFC tags. These tags can be then used for easy connecting between your Bluetooth devices and Android phone. Connecting and disconnecting happens simply by touching the NFC tag with your device.
NFC does not seem to be enabled. You have to enable it manually. Tap OK to start settings. Return to this application with back after you are done.
Please move your define close to writable NFC tag. When tag is found, Bluetooth connectivity information will be written to it.
Enable write protection of the tag
Bluetooth enabled to locate Bluetooth devices.
Your device does not support NFC
Be careful! Read only can NOT be reverted.
Please enable the pair mode of your Bluetooth device, if your device is not listed here.
No Bluetooth devices found. Please check that your Bluetooth device is turned on and in pairing mode. Then restart the device discovery.
Writing to tag failed.\n\nPlease check that tag is not write protected, and there is enough space for data.
Tag does not have enough space for data required.
Given tag is unsupported. Try another.

Links

* video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IbuLGsXIvKI
* source code and issue reporting: https://github.com/alump/BtTagWriter
Adds Handover Select record to tag for better compatibility. Only disable if your tags are too small for all this data.
